arm_group.description: Children (3-5 years) who were diagnosed and treated because of positional plagiocephaly are included in this group.

brief_summary.textblock:
The positional plagiocephaly is a condition involving craniofacial asymmetry. The purpose of
      this study is to evaluate the spine, the posture and the psychomotor state in children who
      were diagnosed with infant plagiocephaly.

detailed_description.textblock:
Positional infant plagiocephaly is a clinical entity in which the shape of an infant's head
      becomes altered as the result of external forces applied to the malleable bones of the
      cranium and can occur pre- or postnatally. It is characterized by asymmetric occipital
      flattening (one side or the central part of the occiput is flattened)with ipsilateral
      frontal bossing.Viewed from above, this results in a parallelogram deformity of the head. We
      hypothesize that children who had plagiocephaly when they were infants, they have postural
      and spine implications at 3-5 years old.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of infant positional plagiocephaly

          -  Aged 3, 4 or 5 years old.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of non synostotic plagiocephaly.

          -  Neurological concomitant condition.

          -  Problems in motor development.

study_pop.textblock: Children who were diagnosed by plagiocephaly and a control group.

intervention.description: The posture, motor development and balance are going to be assessed.

clinical_study.official_title: Postural Assessment in Children With Non-synostotic Plagiocephaly

other_outcome.description: The parents are going to complete the Pediatric Sleep Questionnaire, with different items evaluating the quality of sleep of the children.

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

primary_outcome.description: The spine alignment, segmental and global angles in the sagittal and frontal planes,and the spinal mobility are going to be assessed by the Spinal Mouse®,a device guided manually on the skin along the spine.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The postural assessment comprises the static posture and the spinal flexibility by observing different positions and actions of the children.

The psychomotor development test, TEPSI, is going to be used to assess three areas: coordination, language and motor state. The children are asked to perform different activities and the success is registered.
The balance is assessed with the Pediatric Balance Test, asking the children to perform different tasks and observing the execution of these tasks.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
